# Welcome

I am Professor of Statistical Science in the Biostatistics, Evidence Synthesis, Test Evaluation and Prediction Models ([BESTEAM](https://www.birmingham.ac.uk/research/applied-health/research/besteam/biostatistics-evidence-synthesis-test-evaluation-and-prediction-models-besteam)) group at the University of Birmingham.  
My research focuses on developing statistical methodologies motivated by real-world public health challenges, with particular emphasis on mapping tropical diseases.

## Research Interests

-   Spatial and spatio-temporal modeling\
-   Geostatistical methods for global health applications\
-   Point process models
-   Statistical methods for serological data analysis

For a comprehensive overview of my academic and professional journey, you can access my [full CV](CV_EGiorgi.pdf).
